tweet: #WomensHistoryMonth may be coming to an end, but we celebrate strong and talented women in our office every day. My all-female D.C. team is kicking ass for the people of Arizona—and they make this demanding job look easy. pic.twitter.com/0FyxSf88PX

The importance of the Colorado River to the Southwest cannot be overstated. Nearly 40 percent of the water used in Phoenix comes from the Colorado. We absolutely must protect it, and we must do so without delay. https://stanton.house.gov/media/press-releases/stanton-congress-must-pass-colorado-river-drought-contingency-plan-without …

Today we passed a bipartisan resolution opposing the President’s #TransMilitaryBan—no one with the strength and determination to serve should be turned away because of who they are. This flag is outside my office for #TransVisibiltyWeek to send the message: You #WontBeErased. pic.twitter.com/uIYprCAF7c

56 years after the Equal Pay Act, a woman still earn 80 cents for every dollar a man earns. Imagine the impact if women rightfully took home an additional $10,169 annually. Today we vote on H.R. 7, the #PaycheckFairness Act to ensure women earn equal pay for equal work. pic.twitter.com/GPL0bFwaRD

Proud to play in this year’s Home Court congressional basketball game in support of the Washington Legal Clinic for the Homeless. It’s a non-partisan cause, but that doesn’t mean the Hill’s Angels aren’t playing to win. Repping #9 for #AZ09. pic.twitter.com/In95ZkHWXJ

Just last night, the Administration announced a new attempt to strike down the #ACA, which would cause insurance costs to skyrocket and strip millions of Americans of affordable care. We're going to keep fighting to reduce costs and increase health care access—not take it away.

It’s time to create a health care system that works for everyone. Today we unveiled the Protecting Pre-Existing Conditions and Making Health Care More Affordable Act—major legislation to protect patients with pre-existing conditions and take new steps to lower insurance costs.
Watch live: @TransportDems take a closer look at why investment in our airports is so important. https://twitter.com/TransportDems/status/1110536511257305088 …

Now that Robert Mueller has finished his report, the American people have a right to know what he has found. What do you think? Take the survey:  http://bit.ly/MuellerReportSurvey … pic.twitter.com/CbEmvPCBTB
I look forward to the Attorney General testifying before @HouseJudiciary.

I’ve reviewed the AG’s summary, which raises more questions that should be answered for the American people. These questions can only be answered by releasing the Special Counsel’s full report and its underlying evidence.
Special Counsel Mueller’s report—regardless of its conclusions—must be made public for the American people to read in full in a timely manner. Anything short of complete transparency is unacceptable.
Sounds great! Send my team more details at  http://stanton.house.gov/contact .

I’m grateful to represent such a dynamic, diverse community that plays a key role in driving Arizona’s economic growth. .@azfamily is hosting a phone bank with the Phoenix Police Foundation tonight. Call 1-877-755-2275 from 3 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. to donate to Officer Rutherford's family.

This morning, we lost a member of the @phoenixpolice family. Officer Paul Rutherford served our city for nearly 23 years and was taken too soon. Our hearts are broken for his family, and our prayers are with them.

Electric car designer and manufacturer @Lucid_Motors is building a brand new plant in Arizona, creating thousands of jobs. I’m proud to co-sponsor the #EqualityAct and stand with 280 other members of Congress from both sides of the aisle, 165 leading businesses, 288 organizations from across the US, and 7 out of 10 Americans from all political affiliations to demand equal rights for all.

Too many of our LGBTQ brothers and sisters are still at risk of being fired, evicted or denied services because of who they are. We can’t stand for that. The #EqualityAct will finally provide LGBTQ individuals full protection under the law.

We introduced the #DreamAndPromiseAct today to put Dreamers and those with temporary protected status on a pathway to citizenship. Hundreds of thousands of hardworking young people stand to benefit, and our communities will be stronger with their contributions. #ProtectTheDream pic.twitter.com/bOODlRz3qI
The proposed Trump budget cuts $1.4 trillion from health care, including a shameful $845 billion cut to Medicare. This attack on health care for our seniors is irresponsible and cruel.

When our democracy works #ForThePeople, and when we lift the voices of everyday Americans, elected officials can focus on the issues that matter most to constituents. 

✔️Quality jobs
✔️Affordable health care
✔️Clean air and water
✔️Strong infrastructure

Today we’re delivering on our promise to pass long overdue reforms to:

✔️Get dark money out of politics 
✔️Limit special interests’ influence 
✔️Make elections clean and fair
✔️Demand more of elected officials

H.R. 1 truly is #ForThePeople.

Today was a big one for @ASU and @WexfordSciTech! The future 200,000-square-foot building on the downtown Phoenix Biomedical Campus will house research labs, classrooms, and one-of-a-kind innovation spaces to help advance our fast-growing bioscience industry. https://twitter.com/GPEC/status/1103687485521944576 …

The American people ought to know who is writing big checks to their elected officials and candidates for office. By curbing the influence of special interests, we can lift the voices of everyday Americans. We can do better. And with #HR1, we will do better. #ForThePeople pic.twitter.com/4NDXN5yx27

March is #WomensHistoryMonth, a time to recognize and celebrate the incredible women trailblazers who have changed the world. Spending time to reflect on #HERStory also reminds us that our work isn’t over and we must continue the fight for gender equality.
